fields.description:
When configured Repository Variables, we have very interesting feature

we have several environments, and we created the different keys accordingly to the configuration for example

The values are saved as sensitive. 

Key                 |        Value

user_beta       |        ***

user_master   |        ***

user_staging  |        ***

user_qa          |         ***

user_perf       |        ***

it would be nice if we use an environment instead for replace the correct value

like this:

Key                 |        Value      |    Environment

user               |        ***          |      beta 

user               |        ***          |    master

user                |        ***          |  staging

user                |         ***         |  qa

user                |        ***          |   perf

 

This would be much better because the environment can be used as a Bitbucket variable

 

 

Thanks!
fields.summary: Improve Pipelines  Repository settings Repository Variables

fields.description:
Currently the title of the Pipeline is the name of the commit that started said Pipeline. I think this is good default behavior, but this is not always wanted.

For example in a project with scheduled custom pipelines doing backups and commiting changes at the end. The name of that commit is "Backup - <date of today>", but the pipeline title always has the name of backup from yesterday, which is confusing.
fields.summary: Allow us to change the title of a Pipeline

fields.description: Allow running fastlane commands to send builds to firebase_app_distribution
fields.summary: Run fastlane commands

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Linking Bitbucket Account with an identical project from 2 Jira sites will display only 1 link when an issue is being hovered.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Project from site B with a Bitbucket integration.
# Migrate Project from Site B > A via Server's JMCA and enabled the same BitBucket account into Site A.
# Create an Issue from Bitbucket account

h3. Expected Results
Both links is shown when hovered in Bitbucket Issue

h3. Actual Results
- The issue is created correctly from Bitbucket on both Jira site A & B. However, only Site B link is shown when hover on Bitbucket Issue

Note: 
- Unlink BB account from site B > Bitbucket issue still shows link to site B
- Unlink BB account from Site A (both are unlink now) > Bitbucket issue still shows link to site B

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Linking Bitbucket Account with identical project from 2 Jira sites will display only 1 link when an issue is hovered

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

There is no ability to search commits for a particular author in Bitbucket UI
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Look for option to search commits for a particular author in Bitbucket UI

h3. Expected Results

There should be option to search commits for a particular author.
h3. Actual Results

There is no option to search commits for a particular author.  Also, there is no API available to retrieve this information.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Ability to search commits for a particular author

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When trying to log in Bitbucket after a long time, Bitbucket throws the message:
{code}
We're sorry. Your account has been flagged by our automated system for
possible violation of our Cloud Terms of Service
<http://www.atlassian.com/legal/cloud-terms-of-service>.
{code}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Keep a long period without log in Bitbucket
 # Try to log in

h3. Expected Results

A message stating that the account was deactivated due to a long period without activity.

h3. Actual Results

A message stating that the account was deactivated due to possible violation of Atlassian's Cloud Terms of Service

h3. Workaround

Contact the support team to check what was the violation, long period issue,  and reactivate the account.
fields.summary: Log in Bitbucket after a long time throws the message "possible violation "

fields.description:
Currently you can only look at the diff between branches but what about commits?

If I look at master's HEAD and want to diff it against the hash of -3 commits, there is no way to do that unless I create a branch on that commit and then diff it against master.

So in the end I have to do this in the terminal. It would be great if it was possible on BB.
fields.summary: Add diff on commit level

fields.description: If you move a file to other directory, instead of showing its deleted and new created, it could have just mentioned that the file was moved just like github does. If you refactor a lot and manage file into folders, it will look like a very big change.
fields.summary: Improve file location changes difference in Pull requests

fields.description: Currently, there's no way for the user to view deployment for all the repositories, it would be great if the user can monitor and review their deployment from a single page for all their repositories.
fields.summary: Ability to view deployment of all repositories in project on a single page

fields.description:
Dear Bitbucket, while in review, having collapsed files (to indicate progress with review), it would be useful to expand if new commits change these. Otherwise, any commit after I start I need to notice and start from scratch.

I don't want them to automatically collapse, that I do myself as a sign I've reviewed it enough. Some files will take a few looks, some less. I want them to automatically open if they have changed past review.
fields.summary: After collapsing diffs, expand them when there are changes made

fields.description:
I'm looking some Pipeline logs, and I can't find the timestamp for when a step was started and ended.

I am trying to correlate some external logs with events that happened in the pipeline, but without a timestamp it's hard to narrow down.

This is particularly annoying for manually triggered steps, as they may happen at a later date.
fields.summary: Show start and end timestamp for each Pipeline step

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Previewing a markdown file with code blocks on source page doesn't show the code blocks

Code blocks are shown in the file only when the changes are commited.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open the source page
 # Edit or create a readme file
 # Add a code block (you can use below as example:
{code}
 1. Clone the repo via HTTPS:
 
        git clone HTTPS command
 
    or via SSH:

        git clone SSH command
{code}
 # Click on preview
 #* Note the code block is not shown
 # Commit the changes
 # Go back to source page and open the readme file
 #* Note the code block is shown


h3. Expected Results
Code block is shown when clicking preview in edit mode
h3. Actual Results
Code blocks are not shown when clicking preview in edit mode

h3. Workaround

 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Previewing a markdown file with code blocks on source page doesn't show the code blocks

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When the left-hand Side Menu is opened on a repository, with the mouse hover, various icons often show as blank empty squares particularly when the page has been opened for a while.

!Screen Shot 2020-05-14 at 21.20.58.png|width=121,height=264!

We use custom icons for pipelines, deployments and other third-party add-on added to the repository. There is a 30-minute expiry attached to images that are retrieved from AWS S3.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Steps:
 1. Log in to Bitbucket
 2. Open a normal page, like the commit history or Pipelines or an Issue
 3. Leave the page open for a for hours, perhaps as a background tab
 4. View the side menu using mouse hover, and observe the icons.
h3. Expected Results

The icons on the sidebar of a Repository shouldn't disappear.
h3. Actual Results

The custom icons used for pipelines, deployments, and other third-party add-ons tab often disappear on the Bitbucket Cloud website side menu after an inactivity of 30 minutes.
h3. Workaround

A quick refresh resolves the issue.
fields.summary: Icons often disappear on the Bitbucket website side menu

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Adding a project to repositories through the project page throws an error: No Project matches the given query.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new project
 # Click "Add existing repoitories"
 # Tick any repository and click "Add repository"

h3. Expected Results
You would have the repository associated with that project

h3. Actual Results
You get an error message: No Project matches the given query.

In the backend of Developer tools you can see the error thrown is a 404.
Looking at the request URL we can see it is referencing teams which might be the reason it is failing. 
https://bitbucket.org/!api/internal/teams/undefined/projects/DIF/repositories/

h3. Workaround

Users can manually add the project by changing this information within the repository settings.
fields.summary: Adding a project to repositories through the project page throws an error: No Project matches the given query.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

On the "Users on Plan" settings page in the workspace settings, when there are hundreds of users spanning over multiple pages. It can be tedious to navigate through the pages just to check on certain user's access. 

h3. Suggested Solution
 
Provide a search bar to filter out the users in the Users on Plan page.
fields.summary: Better user searching functionality on the Users on Plan page

fields.description:
Suppressing username would be great to easily create documentation guides.

It is currently available for Bitbucket server:
https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/BSERV-4527
fields.summary: Enable supressing username from git clone button

fields.description:
Currently, when editing a snippet file type for example "file.html" will set the language to HTML, but whenever we change the file type to something else the file name will enforce the file type to change as well..

We should suggest it but not forcing the file type.
fields.summary: Editing snippet will force the file type instead of suggesting it

fields.description:
When you are in the middle of a pull request, Is quite annoying that the name of the branch is not easy to copy, instead you get this tooltip panel where you get a link for the branch that you try to copy by selecting it (trying no to click it smh)... it will be super handy to have a copy button, oh yes there is one! but instead of giving you the name of the branch it gives you a string saying "git checkout branch-name" SMH then you have to delete the "git checkout part" because you wanted to fetch it, or see git logs or anything else other than git checkout, I bet most devs already have a shortcut for "git checkout" so this thing just defeats its purpose...



!image-2020-05-12-14-43-21-346.png!
fields.summary: Copy branch name instead of "git checkout branch name"

fields.description:
We have a project where we build a docker image in Bitbucket pipelines which then must be uploaded to a container registry in China.


However, uploading the image is very slow from bitbucket's CI/CD servers which, based on [this|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Bitbucket-questions/Bitbucket-pipelines-redundancy-resilience/qaq-p/764992], are hosted in the US.

If we could choose where to run Bitbucket pipelines, we could pick a region close to where  we need to deploy our images and drastically reduce the time needed for our CI/CD pipeline.
fields.summary: Select region to run bitbucket pipelines in

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

 

When changing the diff view on a pull request to side-by-side when color accessibility is enabled reverts the accessibility color back to green
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open a pull request with diffs (content added and content removed)
 # Using the gear icon enable color accessibility
 # Change the diff view to side-by-side
 # The bluish accessibility color reverts back to the original green color

h3. Expected Results

* The accessibility color should remain consistent in both the unified and side-by-side views
h3. Actual Results

* The accessibility color reverts back to the traditional color that does not accommodate color blind users 
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Changing the diff view to side-by-side when color accessibility is enabled on a pull request reverts the color back to green

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Profile icon is hidden in Safari and Chrome on iPad, this prevents users from accessing essential parts of Bitbucket Cloud such as switching to different workspaces, personal settings and prevents users from logout.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Login to Bitbucket (bitbcuket.org) in Safari browser on the latest version of iPad
# Try to locate the profile icon on the bottom of the page
# Try to logout by accessing the profile icon

h3. Expected Results
The profile icon on the bottom left side gives the option to access other parts of Bitbucket Cloud and the option log out should be visible

h3. Actual Results
The profile icon on the bottom left side gives access to other parts of Bitbucket Cloud and the option to log out is hidden

h3. Workaround
Please use other supported browser to logout
fields.summary: Profile icon is hidden on Safari and Chrome browser on iPad

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Repository with deep tree directories will cause the filtering feature unusable due to the following endpoint hitting Error 555 !api/internal/repositories/<workspaceID>/<Slug>/tree/<hash>/?no_size=1
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Click on the filter files search box.
 # You get the error message "There was an error filtering files. Please try again later."

!image-2020-05-11-16-32-05-943.png|width=625,height=323!
h3. Expected Results

File filtering should work fine and display the file that is searched.
h3. Actual Results

We get the error message "There was an error filtering files. Please try again later."
h3. Workaround

The only workaround at the moment is to browse the repository on the local filesystem, find the path of the file or directory that you would like to view in the Bitbucket UI and update the URL manually.(example: [https://bitbucket.org/bbtest/bbtestrepo/src/|https://bitbucket.org/]*<ref>/<path_to_file_or_directory>*
fields.summary: File filtering in the source browser fails if the repository's file tree is too large to fetch

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Newlines are not supported in details field in Pipeline Reports API

The [API documentation|https://developer.atlassian.com/bitbucket/api/2/reference/resource/repositories/%7Bworkspace%7D/%7Brepo_slug%7D/commit/%7Bcommit%7D/reports/%7BreportId%7D] says for the details field "A string to describe the purpose of the report. This string may contain escaped newlines and if it does it will display the content accordingly.." but it doesn't work.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Call the Reports API endpoint to create Pipeline reports as mentioned in the [API documentation|https://developer.atlassian.com/bitbucket/api/2/reference/resource/repositories/%7Bworkspace%7D/%7Brepo_slug%7D/commit/%7Bcommit%7D/reports/%7BreportId%7D]
 # Make sure the details fields has new line characters "\n"

h3. Expected Results

The detail field in the generated report should have new line as mentioned in the API call
h3. Actual Results

The detail field in the generated report doesn't have new line as mentioned in the API call
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Newlines are not supported in details field in Pipeline Reports API

fields.description:
Currently, adding SSH key in repository > Access keys only offers read-only access to a specific repository.
[Access keys - Atlassian Documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucket/access-keys-294486051.html]

Some users require to have an SSH key specific only to a single repository with write access.

*Feature request:*
It would be useful to also allow write access for repository Access keys.
fields.summary: Repository Access keys with write access

fields.description:
Allow multiple deployment flows.

In the documentation there are regional deployments (east and west). It would be nice to be able to deploy east to staging and production in no relation to the west deployments. This can be useful if only one region aspect of the repo would need to be deployed.
fields.summary: Monorepo Deployments

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Unable to access Pipeline page in Microsoft Edge browser. The pipeline screen is not loading and stuck on a wait or cancel page
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Access Pipeline page in Microsoft Edge browser

h3. Expected Results

User should be able to view Pipeline page and build results
h3. Actual Results

Unable to access Pipeline in Microsoft Edge browser. The pipeline screen is not loading and stuck on a wait or cancel page
h3. Workaround

User another supported browser to view Pipeline. Here is the [link|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucket/which-browsers-does-bitbucket-support-296092232.html] of supported browser.
fields.summary: Unable to access Pipeline page in Microsoft Edge browser

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
As the title says, it's not possible to create workspaceIDs longer than 30 characters. 

This was not communicated on any of workspaces' official documentation (https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucket/change-a-workspace-id-966686598.html) nor on the workspace create page, nor on the workspaceID update page.

Even though that's the case, Bitbucket does accept input larger than 30 characters on the workspaceID field, due to the maxlength property being set to 100 instead of 30 in the HTML code.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
There are two ways to reproduce this:
On Workspace creation:
 # Click on the "+" icon on Bitbucket
 # Click on "Create" > "Workspace"
 # On the WorkspaceID field, type in a workspaceID larger than 30 characters
 # You will receive a 500 error on the console

On workspaceID update
 # Navigate to an existing workspace
 # Click on the "Settings" page
 # Attempt to change the workspaceID to be longer than 30 characters
 # You will receive a "Something went wrong error message.

h3. Expected Results
Bitbucket Cloud to stop accepting inputs longer than 30 characters on the workspaceID field and the UI needs to communicate in some way that workspaceIDs larger than 30 characters are not accepted.

h3. Actual Results
Bitbucket throws a generic 500 error when typing workspaceIDs larger than 30 characters, and accepts this input instead of blocking workspaceIDs larger than 30 characters.

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: It's impossible to create workspaceIDs larger than 30 characters

fields.description:
It would be great if there was a way to increase PR thresholds for specific large PRs.

As of today, for larger PR, it has to be reviewed and merged locally or split into multiple smaller PRs.

For some cases, it is not possible to make them smaller and we would still like to use Bitbucket to review these changes.

Business case:
If there is a string manipulation method or some other atomic change that is populated over 2k+ files, those files will not be displayed on Bitbucket.
fields.summary: Increase PR thresholds to view larger changes

fields.description: User should be able to exclude or remove a repository from the Recent Repositories on the Dashboard.
fields.summary: Remove unwanted repository from Recent Repositories list

fields.description:
The banner saying there is an incident is a good thing.

Keeping it there without providing detail is not.

 

Please stop chasing my clicks and add summary information about the incident so I can see if it affects my usage. I will click the provided link if I think it does.

 

Please allow the warning banner to go away like a cooke warning. You don't get to keep me in a state of warning it's annoying and makes me think bad things about your product.
fields.summary: Orange banner when there is an incident doesn't go away

fields.description:
Github now supports rich rendering of jupyter notebooks:

https://github.com/blog/1995-github-jupyter-notebooks-3

It would be great if Bitbucket did as well.  Jupyter notebooks are increasingly used as a format for documentation, sharing computations, and reproducible data science in general.
fields.summary: Enable rich rendering of Jupyter notebooks (BB-12986)

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

UI does not render the button to create a new project for a workspace
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to any of your workspaces.
 # Click on Projects.
 # You do not see UI controls to create a new project. It seems like the UI button to create the project is not rendered correctly.

h3. Expected Results

The create project button should be rendered correctly in the UI
h3. Actual Results

!image-2020-05-06-18-51-03-886.png|width=601,height=334!
h3. Workaround

You can create a project by clicking in the + option in the sidebar

!image-2020-05-06-18-55-13-882.png|width=274,height=258!

 

!image-2020-05-06-19-01-17-524.png|width=196,height=265!
fields.summary: UI does not render the button to create a new project for a workspace

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

After changing a workspace name, the old workspace name will show up on other sections of Bitbucket as below -
 * After clicking the magnifying glass icon on the workspace page to look for code on that workspace.
 * Posting the commit or branch link of a repository into Slack 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a workspace named A
 # Change workspace name from Workspace settings to B
 # Click the magnifying glass icon on the workspace page to look for code on that workspace 
 # Post the commit or branch link of a repository into Slack 

h3. Expected Results

Workspace name B is displayed while searching the code or posting the commit or branch link of a repository into Slack 
h3. Actual Results

Workspace name A is displayed while searching the code or posting the commit or branch link of a repository into Slack 
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Workspace Name not updating in some sections of Bitbucket

fields.description:
Currently, it is not possible to create a protected branch(branch permission set up to restrict access to certain users only) using the API using the Team account/workspace OAuth credentials. We get BRANCH_PERMISSION_VIOLATED error.
h3. Steps to reproduce the error:
 * Create oAuth for the TEAM workspace atlas_team123
 * Create Access token using oAuth key and secret of atlas_team123 TEAM workspace
{code:java}
curl -X POST -u key:secret https://bitbucket.org/site/oauth2/access_token -d grant_type=client_credentials
{code}

 * Create repo_bbs repository in atlas_team123 TEAM account
 * Setup branch permission for *release/** branch and give Administrators group only write access in atlas_team123/repo_bbs
 * Administrators group has only one individual account and not TEAM workspace atlas_team123
 * Make an API call to create a branch using the access token for atlas_team123 TEAM account 
{code:java}
curl 'https://api.bitbucket.org/2.0/repositories/atlas_team123/repo_bbs/refs/branches' -A 'bitbucket-api-client/1.1' -H 'Content-Type: application/json' -H 'Accept: application/json' -H 'Authorization: Bearer xxxx' -X POST -d '{"name":"release\/20.20.20","target":{"hash":"master"}}'
{code}
*You will receive the below error*
{code:java}
{"data": {"key": "BRANCH_PERMISSION_VIOLATED"}, "type": "error", "error": {"message": "You are not allowed to create a branch that matches the pattern \"release/*\".", "data": {"key": "BRANCH_PERMISSION_VIOLATED"}}}$ {code}

This is because we have a branch permission to restrict access to certain users only and team accounts/workspace cannot be added as users in the branch permission.

Hence even though the team account/workspace is the owner of the repository the team account's OAuth cannot be used to create the restricted branch.

This affects the customers as they need to add a service account to the group that has branch permission and use the service account's OAuth credentials to create the branch.

It would be good to have the ability to use the team account/workspace OAuth instead.
fields.summary: Cannot create protected branches using the OAuth consumer belonging to the team account/workspace.

fields.description:
Currently in Bitbucket Cloud with the Re-Deploy feature, it works well when you want to re-deploy a previous deployment. To do so, you just need to select the previous deployment and select re-deploy. 

However, this required to be triggered manually. 

It would be great to have a feature that could automatically re-deploy the last successful build if the current deployment fails. This way, manual intervention could be avoided.
fields.summary: Ability to automatically re-deploy last successful build

fields.description:
To find the URL of the source tree of a remote Bitbucket repository more intuitively, please link the `src` folder to the `tree` folder, like, for example, GitHub and Gitlab do.
Then, for example, command line programs that guess the URL of the source tree will succeed in doing so not only, for example, in GitHub and Gitlab, but also Bitbucket remote repositories.
fields.summary: link src folder to tree folder

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When you give direct repo access to a user on one workspace and then that repo is:
 * either deleted 
 * or transferred to a different account

The user will still appear on the members screen.  However that user will not have any access to the workspace or any other repos owned by that workspace
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a repo
 # Invite a user with only direct access to that repository
 # once the user accepts the invite they will appear on the members screen
 # now delete the repo or transfer it to a different workspace
 # go back to the original workspace and see members page
 # the user will still show up as part of the workspace

h3. Expected Results

Once that repository is deleted or transferred to a different workspace, that user should no longer be showing on the members page of the original workspace
h3. Actual Results

User appearing as a member, but he is not any longer
h3. Workaround

No current workaround available
fields.summary: When user is added to a repo on workspace and then the repo is deleted that user will still appear on Members page

fields.description:
Whenever Pipelines identifies that a common documented error has happened within the build, it will show the following nag:
 !Screen Shot 2020-05-01 at 11.30.58.png|thumbnail! 

This feature request is to stop it from showing up at all. The suggestion here is to add a "Don't ask again" checkbox to confirm that the user no longer wishes to get these suggestions.
fields.summary: Add "Don't ask again" checkbox on the "Based on your build errors, this might help" Pipelines nag

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The syntax highlighting does not work while viewing the Clojure file.
It works perfectly fine when editing but when viewing the file the syntax highlighting does not work.
 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a sample clojure(.clj) file.
 # View the file in the repository source.
 # We see that the syntax highlighting is not working.

h3. Expected Results

Syntax highlighting should work while viewing the file. Currently, it works only while editing the file.

!image-2020-05-01-15-09-16-808.png|width=322,height=211!
h3. Actual Results

Syntax highlighting does not work while viewing Clojure files 

 

!image-2020-05-01-15-08-36-238.png|width=317,height=268!

I understand that Bitbucket Cloud UI uses Monaco editor for viewing files and CodeMirror editor for editing the files.

Even though the Monaco editor supports Clojure syntax, Bitbucket UI does not support it. 

Monaco editor: [https://microsoft.github.io/monaco-editor/.|https://microsoft.github.io/monaco-editor/]
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Syntax highlighting for .clj (clojure) files does not work correctly when viewing the file

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Syntax highlighting in comments does not work when the lab feature " Embedded HTML in markdown beta" is enabled.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Under Labs, enable the "Embedded HTML in markdown beta" feature.
 # The comments made on PRs, diffs, etc does not highlight the syntax.

h3. Expected Results

!image-2020-05-01-13-15-32-210.png|width=653,height=327!
h3. Actual Results

!image-2020-05-01-13-15-48-690.png|width=657,height=371!
h3. Workaround

The only workaround currently is to disable the feature "Embedded HTML in markdown beta"
fields.summary: Syntax highlighting in comments does not work when the lab feature " Embedded HTML in markdown beta" is enabled.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

API call for workspace members does not return workspace privacy status and permissions.

[https://developer.atlassian.com/bitbucket/api/2/reference/resource/workspaces/%7Bworkspace%7D/members/%7Bmember%7D]
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Run curl -X GET -u username:AppPassword [https://api.bitbucket.org/2.0/workspaces/workspace_slug/members/account_ID]

 # Note within the response the workspace the is_privateboolean and permissionstring are missing.

h3. Expected Results

The above API would return the member's privacy status and permissions for the user within the workspace
h3. Actual Results

The above API does not return the member's privacy status and permissions for the user within the workspace
h3. Workaround

The permissions have been moved to the workspace permissions endpoint and can be requested by following details on: [https://developer.atlassian.com/bitbucket/api/2/reference/resource/workspaces/%7Bworkspace%7D/permissions] 

With the request to the member endpoint, we do not return a full output, you will need to modify the API call to obtain the  more granular response, here is the example: 

"2.0/workspaces/WorkspaceID/members/\{User-UUID}?fields=workspace.*"
fields.summary: API call for workspace members does not return workspace privacy status and  permissions

fields.description:
*Summary:*
We have multiple users who have aws accounts and use the same pipelines to deploy to AWS cloud. Hence, we would need custom set of variables to be set per user. Hence arises the need for user level variables.

*Workaround:*
We don't have a workaround for this at this point in time.
fields.summary: Bitbucket Pipelines User-level Variables

fields.description:
Currently, each account contains a default personal workspace that's associated with the account.
It's not possible to delete this workspace.

This request is to add the ability to delete the default personal workspace.
fields.summary: Allow to delete workspace associated with the user account.

fields.description:
Our main active repository has lots of users we use Bitbucket premium, we have a production branch and a default development branch. When I go to branch permissions and enable a default reviewer check on production branch Bitbucket enforces that to whole repository. 

Is it possible to limit this change to be applicable when a PR is made against that production branch but not the whole repository instead?
fields.summary: Default reviewers applicable to specific branch

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Adding a user to an Admin group on a workspace that was converted from personal accounts,  will not give those users Admin rights for that workspace. Users will not have permission to add new users, projects, or snippets for that workspace. 

The owner of the converted workspace is affected in a different way, as he/she will not be able to add himself/herself to any group under their workspace.
This will affect the "branch permission" and other features where the access is either granted or limited to a given group. 


h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an administrator group into a workspace converted from a personal account and try to add users to this group,  without success to add yourself.  
 # Ask other users to perform actions that would require admin access to the workspace

h3. Expected Results

The users should be able to perform changes that require admin access to the workspace
The owner of the workspace should be able to be listed as member of the groups that he administrates.

h3. Actual Results

The users are not able to perform changes that require admin access to the workspace and will face a Permissions denied error.
The owner is not able to be listed as a member of the groups that he administrates.

h3. Workaround

Create a new workspace,  different from the converted workspace, should work properly, allowing users in the Admin group to administer that workspace and for the workspace owner to be added to groups.
fields.summary: Granting admin access to other users to workspaces converted from personal accounts is not working

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
This is an intermittent issue for Bitbucket Pipelines where builds will fail with the following error message on dotnet builds:
{code}
System.IO.IOException : The configured user limit (128) on the number of inotify instances has been reached, or the per-process limit on the number of open file descriptors has been reached.
{code}

The same issue doesn't happen locally.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 No steps to reproduce, this is intermittent

h3. Expected Results
Dotnet builds will have the same results as a local run.

h3. Actual Results
Dotnet builds are intermittently failing due to the number of inotify instances limit being 128.

h3. Workaround
Re-run the build, as this is intermittent.
fields.summary: Inotify user limit instances causes builds to fail due to low limit (KUBE-3327)

fields.description:
In the new PR experience, the "Ignore whitespace" option is moved under global settings. 

!image-2020-04-29-15-39-51-525.png|width=376,height=209!

In the Old PR experience, this option is available for each diff under ... option

!image-2020-04-29-15-40-54-802.png|width=676,height=104!

 

This impacts some customers who generally keep the "Ignore whitespace" option 'off' as per their workflow. However, they need to enable the option while reviewing a file with lot of whitespaces.

When the user is in the middle of reviewing a PR, if he sees a huge file with tons of whitespace changes, he has to scroll all the way to the top of the PR to enable the option and then go back to file which he was reviewing. This is annoying to the user.
h3.
fields.summary: Need the "Ignore whitespace" option for each diff in the PR

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

For *private* workspaces, users in a User group that does not have at least 'Create repo' permissions, are not able to view repos listed when opening the Workspace URL
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Bitbucket User 1
 # Create a Bitbucket User 2
 # Log in to Bitbucket User 1
 # Create a Workspace, Workspace1
 # In this workspace's Settings, check the option *Keep this workspace private*, and then *Update workspace*
 # In Workspace1, create a new User Group, 'Test Users'
 # Default repository access does not matter, select whatever you want
 # Leave 'Create repositories' and 'Administer workspace' options *unchecked*
 # Add Bitbucket User 2 in 'Test Users' of Workspace1

Then:
 # Log in to Bitbucket with Bitbucket User 2
 # Accept the invitation to Workspace1
 # Open the page [https://bitbucket.org/workspace1/]

*Notes:* the same issue occurs if Bitbucket User 2 tries to access any workspace URL, like
* https://bitbucket.org/workspace1/workspace/repositories
* https://bitbucket.org/workspace1/workspace/projects/
* https://bitbucket.org/workspace1/workspace/snippets/
* https://bitbucket.org/workspace1/workspace/members/

h3. Expected Results

The page lists the Workspace repos this user has access to
h3. Actual Results

The user sees a message saying:
{quote}You were never here
 The contents of this workspace are highly confidential. Let's keep this visit between us.
{quote}
h3. Workaround

There is no workaround at the moment.
The URLs above will work for affected users if a workspace admin:
* either deselects the private profile for the workspace
* or gives to the user groups at least *Create repositories* permissions
fields.summary: For private workspaces, users in a User group that does not have at least 'Create repo' permissions, are not able to view repos listed when opening the Workspace URL

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Users in a User Group that does not have at least 'Create repo permissions' (now, or did not have it enabled at least once in the past), cannot create snippets in this Workspace.

*Please note*, this only affects newly created User Groups in a Workspace. When a Workspace is created, two User groups are created for this Workspace as well, 'Administrators' and 'Developers'.

The bug is not reproducible for these two User groups, even if you change their permissions.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Bitbucket User 1
 # Create a Bitbucket User 2
 # Log in to Bitbucket User 1
 # Create a Workspace, Workspace1
 # In Workspace1, create a new User Group, 'Test Users'
 # Default repository access does not matter, select whatever you want
 # Leave 'Create repositories' and 'Administer workspace' options *unchecked*
 # Add Bitbucket User 2 in 'Test Users' of Workspace1

Then:
 # Log in to Bitbucket with Bitbucket User 2
 # Accept the invitation to Workspace1
 # From the sidebar on the left, select *Create* >> *Snippet*

h3. Expected Results

The workspace 'Workspace1' will show as an option for snippet owner, in the dropdown 'Create in'
h3. Actual Results

The workspace 'Workspace1' does *not* show as an option for snippet owner, in the dropdown 'Create in'
h3. Workaround
 # Log in with Bitbucket User 1
 # Go the User Groups page of Workspace1
 # Open Test Users User Group
 # Select *Edit* for the User Group
 # Check the option *Create repositories* for this User group and *Save*

If you want, you can then disable this option, and the bug will still no longer occur
 # Then *Edit* this User Group again, uncheck the option *Create repositories* and *Save*
fields.summary: Users in a User Group that does not have 'Create repo' permissions (now, or at least once enabled in the past), cannot create snippets in this Workspace

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Currently, when a build has multiple variables configured (including Repository Variables, Account Variables, Deployment Variables) and has a total of 120K characters combined, it could cause the pipelines build to be in a hung state.  

This could be misleading as the actual error message isn't displayed nor informative. 

A suggestion is to : 
# Include an informative message indicating that pipelines build failed for the reason. 
# Instead of allowing the build to be hung indefinitely until timeout, it's better if builds could be stopped / marked as failed.
fields.summary: Provide informative error when pipelines build is hung caused by variable length

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

For accounts and repositories that existed prior to workspaces rollout, if you try to go to your Workspace > Projects > select a project > Add repositories by checking the box > you will face an error.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

1. go to /dashboard/overview
2. click on Projects
3. click on any Project 
 4. click on Add Repositories button in right top corner
 5. select check box to 1 or more repos 
 6. click on Add Repositories button -> You will face an error
h3. Expected Results

To be able to bulk update project belonging for repositories in bulk
h3. Actual Results

Currently we are facing an issue with "Something Went wrong" and a 404 error as if the project doesn't exist
h3. Workaround
 # For newly created Repositories the user will be able to select a Project during the repository creation and that is correctly assigned. 
 # For existing repositories, the user can go into the Repository Settings and under Repository Details select an appropriate Project > Save Repository Details.
fields.summary: Bulk Adding repositories to a new project from Projects menu is broken

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Cloning snippets both on HTTPS and SSH provides an error due to the incorrect URL provided by the UI clone button.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a snippet
 # Click on Clone button
 # Copy either HTTPS or SSH url
 # Execute in terminal
 ** For HTTPS it will error like this:
{panel}
remote: Not Found
 fatal: repository 'https://\{username}@bitbucket.org/\{username}/workspace/snippets/\{encoded_snipper_id}/\{snippet_slug}.git/' not found
{panel}

 * 
 ** For SSH it will error like this:
{panel}
Repository \{username}/workspace not found
 fatal: Could not read from remote repository.

Please make sure you have the correct access rights
 and the repository exists.
{panel}

h3. Expected Results

The clone command to execute without errors and clone snippet locally
h3. Actual Results

The clone commands errors without cloning the snippet
h3. Workaround

Adjust the clone URL as below:
 For HTTPS:
 Git clone command provided by the UI:
{code:java}
git clone https://{user_name}@bitbucket.org/{user_name}/workspace/snippets/{encoded_snipper_id}/{snippet_slug}.git
{code}
Git clone command which can be executed correctly:
{code:java}
git clone https://{user_name}@bitbucket.org/snippets/{user_name}/{encoded_snipper_id}/{snippet_slug}.git
{code}
For SSH:
 Git clone command provided by the UI:
{code:java}
git clone git@bitbucket.org:{user_name}/workspace/snippets/{encoded_snipper_id}/{snippet_slug}.git
{code}
Git clone command which can be executed correctly:
{code:java}
git clone git@bitbucket.org:snippets/{user_name}/{encoded_snipper_id}/{snippet_slug}.git
{code}
fields.summary: Cloning snippets both on HTTPS and SSH provides an error

fields.description:
It would be good to have an environment variable that contains the timestamp for when the build started.

Currently I can't find anything like this. Also there doesn't seem to be a way to create one myself that would stay the same _across the pipeline_. I could use Linux's `date` command to get the current date in _one step_, but I believe I can't persist that across the other steps.

The use case would be that since Bitbucket Pipelines [can't handle MSSQL databases|[https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Bitbucket-questions/Running-MSSQL-service-in-Bitbucket-Pipeline/qaq-p/696956]], the idea would be to have an external DB server where DBs would dynamically get created per pipeline (for running e2e tests), and I would need the date or timestamp in order to name the dynamically in such a way that a Lambda script would be able to periodically delete old DBs based on their name that would contain the timestamp/date when they were created.
fields.summary: Add an environment variable with the build timestamp

fields.description:
Hello Team,

Submitting a feature request to have an additional notification for customers notifying at 500mb (Currently we have this at 1GB in the UI)

Stay Safe & Have a wonderful day!
Regards
Manu Abraham
fields.summary: Repository at 500MB Notification

fields.description: Please add feature where developer can specify number of cpu cores they want to use when using pipelines to speed up the process.
fields.summary: Ability to specify number of cores in pipelines

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Bitbucket Repository UI could use repository filtering options with Pipelines. Allowing users to filter all repositories which have a pipeline configured
h3. Workaround

We can currently identify them based on BUILDs with a status on the build on the repository
fields.summary: Repository Filtering Options

fields.description:
Hi, I use pipeline definition for simplify my builds.
definition is a good feature.

Some suggestions for improve it


Only 2 'phases' in step for customization : script and after script. It's should be better if there are more hook for customize build. Remenber, when I want to customize script phase, I override all the script. Even I want just modify one line of script. pre-script for exemple to allow to set variables or other.

About variables. We can set variable in Bitbucket account.
But no way for set variables (global and by step) for customization

And finally more complicated
We can do sequential step and parallels step, but we cannot really mix them, i propose something like that : 
{code:java}
pipelines:
default:
  - sequence: # SEQUENCIAL
    - parallel: # IN SEQUENCE
      - sequence: # SEQUENCIAL
        - step: # IN SEQUENCE
            name: Build 1
            image: node:10.15.0
            before-script: # SUGGESTION
              - something 
            script:
              - something
            after-script
              - something
            artifacts:
              - dist/**
        - step: # IN SEQUENCE
            name: Build 2
            image: node:10.15.0
            script:
              - something 
            artifacts:
              - dist/**
      - step: # IN PARALLEL
    - step: # IN SEQUENCE


{code}
 

Thanks for your works
fields.summary: NEW PHASE/STEP IN STEP

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

For users with managed accounts, when company is worries about  their IP to be cloned and posted as public. The Admin of the Organization would like to have a granular control over: 
 # who can create a repository in their own space
 # what type of repository (public/private) the user can create
 # Prevent the user from posting anything publicly on Bitbucket
 # Allow Admins to see which user has App Password uploaded to their Bitbucket account
 # Which user has SSH keys uploaded to their Bitbucket Account.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

NA
h3. Expected Results

To prevent any user with a managed account to create a public repo against their owned workspace
h3. Actual Results

As of right now, we do not have a way to prevent users with managed accounts from creating individual workspace and publish any data on there, public or private
h3. Workaround

none
fields.summary: Provide Organization Admins with granular control over managed Bitbucket accounts

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

On the branch page in a repository, by default, the user will be viewing the "Active Branches" view.

It is possible for the user to switch between "Active Branches", "All Branches" and "Merged Branches" using a dropdown bar on the top but there is no way to configure which view to be used as the default view.

h3. Suggested Solution

Please allow the users to configure the default view of the branches page.
fields.summary: Please allow users to configure default Branch View

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
At Repository Settings> Repository Variables screen, "View Account Variables" is not working. Throw error  449d5e3f7b494832a4cdc0cebf9bde09
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to Repository Setting, click Repository Variables
 # On the top message, click "View Account Variables"

h3. Expected Results
User is redirected to Workspace Settings >  Account Variables
https://bitbucket.org/{workspace-name}/workspace/settings/addon/admin/pipelines/account-variables

h3. Actual Results
Redirects to https://bitbucket.org/account/user/{workspace-name}/addon/admin/pipelines/account-variables
And throw error id 449d5e3f7b494832a4cdc0cebf9bde09

h3. Workaround
# Click on the workspace
# Workspace Settings
# Account Variables
fields.summary: At Repository Variables screen, "View Account Variables" is not working

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Someone who is not logged in to Bitbucket receives an error when they submit an issue on the repositories issue tracker
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Use a public repository
 # In Bitbucket the repository, enable the issue tracker (Repository settings > Features > Issue tracker > Select 'Public issue tracker' > Select 'Anonymous users can create issues' > Save
 # Open a private window and access the repository
 # Click on the Issues section (Nav bar on the left)
 # Click the create issue button
 # Fill in the fields
 # Complete the CAPTCHA
 # Click the Submit button

h3. Expected Results
 * The issue reported should be submitted

h3. Actual Results

An error is returned with error code:
{noformat}
Something went wrong
While we check things on our end, refresh the page and contact support if the problem persists.
When contacting support, provide them with this code:
6aea080b017f4345911fefbf7782f721
Our status page may also provide additional details.
{noformat}
h3. Workaround


 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Users who are not logged in to Bitbucket receives an error when they submit an issue

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Plan Detail phrase on Plan Details page using spanish language is not displaying the current plan name.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to personal settings
# Change language to spanish
# Pick a workspace
# Go to workspace settings
# Go to "Detalles del plan
# Notice the following message: Tu plan actual es %(planName)

h3. Expected Results
The phrase would display the current plan

h3. Actual Results
The phrase display a static variable name

h3. Workaround

 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Plan Detail phrase on Plan Details page using spanish language is not displaying the plan name

fields.description:
At this time, defining a variable with the name "*PATH*" in Account variables, Repository variables, and Deployment variables. The default $PATH variable on the image being running gets overridden and results in the following error:

<command_name>: Command not found

It would be great if we can aware the user's about this in the pipeline variables page and in the form of relevant documentation.

*For User's:*

**Avoid using "*PATH*" as a variable name in the account, repository, and deployment variable sections for the reason shared above. Try using a detailed name that adds more context on why the variable is being used, example: "remote_path", "web_path", "destination_path" etc.
fields.summary: Command not found error on Pipelines

fields.description:
Is it possible with Bitbucket to setup a Disaster recovery across two regions.

Primary - One region (Shared filstore, Shared database)

Standby - Another region (Shared filstore, Shared database)

Is it possible to set this up in any cloud like GCP, Azure??
fields.summary: Bitbucket Disaster Recovery across two different regions
Snippet API endpoint is returning error

fields.description:
This request has already been made for Jira and was sadly closed despite being something that would greatly speedup the handling of issues.

*I would like there to be an option (or simply have it always enabled) in BitBuckets web interface that makes it so Issues that have been changed in anyway since the last time I personally read/accessed them are somehow marked as "unread".*

This is typically done by changing the font of the link to the issue to a bold one and is very common in forums and other similar discussion areas.

I currently have no way of knowing which issues have been changed since I last looked looked at them unless I somehow remember the exact times I last checked them (clearly unreasonable). The email notifications are helpful but are *NOT* equivalent as they easily can contain redundancies and are much, much less time efficient than seeing where there have been changes in the Issue Tracker itself. 

For example, I see one Issue has been updated in one email, look at it to get up to date, but then there may be several more emails about the same issue further up in my Inbox that are now a waste of time/space because I've already checked into that issue; however, I can't simply ignore all of them 100% of the time based on the time the email was sent, because what if an issue is updated a few minutes after I started checking through the issues but already passed the one that is updated? That email could be regarding an update I was already aware of, or a brand new one that just happened to come a few minutes after I previously checked. This then leads to second guessing the exact times that I did check certain issues where inaccuracies down to the minute mater.

All of this and more could be avoided if Issues with unread updates were simply made bold, which is quite a trivial addition. A simple table per user of the last times issues were opened could be compared to the last time the issue was updated.

If (issueUpdateTime > userLastCheckTime)

   makeBold(issueTitle)

I can only suspect that others would be greatly benefited by such a feature as well, and see no reason why this shouldn't be accepted even if it is made low priority.
fields.summary: Add option for marking updated issues as "unread", i.e using a bold font

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In a public repo and issue tracker, assignee of an issue can be only a user who has ben given explicit access to the repo, either via a User Group or with direct repo access.

An attempt to assign the issue to someone other than that, gives an error "User is not a collaborator on this repository". 

However, auto-completion for issue assignee still shows all Bitbucket users. This is counter-intuitive, considering that it is not possible to assign the issue to any user.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a public repo and issue tracker
 # Give read, write or admin access to some users for this repo
 # Create an issue in the issue tracker and in the field 'Assignee' start typing letters

h3. Expected Results

Only users who have been granted access to the repo should show in the results, as options for assignee.

h3. Actual Results

Users who have not been added to the repo show in the auto-completion list.

h3. Workaround

 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Auto-completion for issue assignee in public repo/issue tracker, shows all Bitbucket users

fields.description: Our team recently migrated to Bitbucket Cloud (from Server), and I have had repeated questions from users which plan we are on, as features they want to use are marked with 'Premium'. Since we are on the Premium plan, those markers are somewhat unnecessary and a potential source of confusion for people.
fields.summary: Remove Premium marker from UI when workspace is on Premium plan

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Reply on a comment in PR view doesn't seem to work.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # go to [https://bitbucket.org/atlassian/jswdd-processor/pull-requests/695/fuse-8918-automated-issue-reporting/diff]
 # find a comment from Daniel in file  bin/run-in-bamboo.sh, line 17
 # click reply

h3. Expected Results

Reply window should appear
h3. Actual Results

Nothing happens
{noformat}
...
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

No workaround
fields.summary: Reply button in PR doesn't work

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When you have multiple open PRs in Bitbucket and merge those branches locally, then push merged changes to Bitbucket, all affected Pull requests will be marked as merged on bitbucket, however they are all going to point to the same merge commit. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Ceate 3 branches off master branch

 # each branch continues to evolve independently.

 # You create 3 PR in BB UI for each branch - leave them Open.

 # You fetch those 3 branches locally.

 # Then checkout master and merge each of those 3 branches into master 1 by 1, all locally.

 # Then you push master branch up to BB.

 # For the open PRs for each branch - they are now marked as merged - each PR has the same merge commit and each PR has changes from other branches - when those were unrelated to each other.

h3. Expected Results

To show in Bitbucket UI separate commit for each branch merge
h3. Actual Results

Each of the open Pull Requests that should be marked as merge with the update from local merge action points to the same merge commit instead of separate and includes changes from other branches, those should be unrelated and introduced from each branch independent of each other. 
h3. Workaround
 # Do a push to remote after a merge of 1 branch into master. 
 # Review and merge PRs in Bitbucket UI one by one.
fields.summary: Merging multiple branches locally for existing open PRs in Bitbucket will create same merge commit

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Currently, it's possible to fork empty repositories.
This causes a problem where, whenever you attempt to create a pull request on the fork of said repository to the forked repo, it will throw a "Something went wrong" error, along with an enclosed error code.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an empty repository. Make sure to not add anything to it;
 # After creating the said repository, click on "+" > "Fork this repository;
 # Add some commit(s) to this repository;
 # Attempt to create a pull request to the upstream repository;
 # You will see a "Something went wrong error".

h3. Expected Results
Either being unable to fork empty repositories or add a notice stating that the upstream needs to have at least one commit in it before creating a pull request

h3. Actual Results
Attempting to create a Pull request to an empty repository will throw a "Something went wrong" error that does not have any pointers on what do to next.

h3. Workaround
Add a commit to the upstream repository. This will allow the pull request to be created to the upstream.
fields.summary: Creating a pull request from a fork to an empty repository returns a something went wrong error

fields.description:
Logging into Bitbucket on a browser with pop-up blocker plugins (e.g. [https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/pop-up-blocker-for-chrome/bkkbcggnhapdmkeljlodobbkopceiche)|https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/pop-up-blocker-for-chrome/bkkbcggnhapdmkeljlodobbkopceiche] can lead to malformed requests.

It'd be nice if the format of the login page/something was improved so that users could use these plugins without interfering with login.
fields.summary: Improve Bitbucket login experience in browser with pop-up blockers

fields.description: When somebody make a comment on a commit (in the commit page) from a pull request it does not appear on the pull request activity bar. The suggestion here is to notify on the activity bar whenever a comment was made even on the commit page (when it is related to a pull request). In this way it would be easier to code review.
fields.summary: Comments inside commit does not appear on pull request activity bar

fields.description:
Currently, code review on commits is available. The request here is to have a feature to code review on files with an ability to add comments on the files that have changes.

This feature will help in uses cases when the repository has large number of pre-historic files and the ability to perform code review on files and add comments instead of doing it on commits as the commit history would be huge.
fields.summary: Code review for files with ability to add comments

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Merge button is not visible in Pull request in Old pull request view for certain users. The user has write access to the repository and is part of the group given _*Merge via pull request*_ permission for the target branch in _*Branch permissions*_


h3. Steps to Reproduce

[~gmarcolino] {color:#00875A}Update:{color}

# While not logged in Bitbucket or using a link to Pull Request page saved in the browser cached information, access a Pull Request that is open and check that the merger button is not available
# Log into Bitbucket using your credentials that have access to merge the Pull Request
# Check once again the Pull Request page and confirm that the merger button is still not available.

h3. Expected Results

Merge button should visible in Pull request in Old pull request view.

h3. Actual Results

Merge button is not visible in Pull request in Old pull request view.
h3. Workaround

Use one of the workaround available below -
 * Use *_New pull request view_* Lab feature to view the Pull request. Merge button will be available in *_New pull request view_*. Use the below instructions to enable New pull request view -
 **  Below instructions to be used by the user viewing the Pull request owned by individual account. In case of TEAM account, below instructions to be used by the owner of the repository in a TEAM account
 *** Click on Avatar on lower left corner
 *** Select _*Bitbucket Labs*_ option
 *** Enable _*New pull request view*_ lab feature
 * Alternatively, re-add the permissions in the _*Branch permissions*_ for the group user is part of and have been given Merge via pull request permission. User would be able to view the Merge button in Old pull request view.
 ** It has also been observed that Directly accessing the pull-request page or refreshing the page does not show the merge button in Firefox in Old pull request after re-adding the permission. This can be resolved by going to the pull request page first and then clicking on the pull request shows the merge button. This issue doesn't appear in Chrome browser.
* [~gmarcolino] {color:#00875A}Update:{color} Clear the cached information on your browser and access the Pull Request page again.
** As an alternative you can cmd+shift+r or crtl+shift+f5 to completely reload the page.
* [~gmarcolino] {color:#00875A}Update:{color} Deactivate the option to cache information on your browser, as by doing so you will always be refreshing your Pull Request pages when you access it.
fields.summary: Merge button is not visible in Pull request in Old pull request view

fields.description:
Currently, if you are viewing a diff that happens to have a bunch of autogenerated files that you don't really care about, site performance is severely impacted.

Example:\\
A current pull request I'm reviewing has a reference.cs file with ~3000 lines of new auto-generated code and a generated wsdl of ~2000 lines of code, along with other programmer code that I actually want to review.  This situation basically renders the code review tool worthless.

We've also run into this issue numerous times when we have test files that are in xml (in our case rdl's).

It would be great if the reviewer had the ability to show/hide files at will to improve the site's performance, or some other way to break the diff up into manageable pieces.
fields.summary: Improve performance of large code reviews

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Files on the main branch are not copied over when a new branch is created from the main branch.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Identify the repo's main branch (Repo settings > Repository Details > Main branch
 # Add a file a branch other than the main branch 
 # Merge the branch containing the file to the main branch (Branches > Click the three ellipses > Merge > Merge
 # Go back to the source page the main branch contains the new file
 # Create a new branch from the main branch (Branches > Create branch >From branch is defaulted to the main branch > create

h3. Expected Results

The files on the main branch should be copied over to the newly created branch
h3. Actual Results

The new files are not copied over
h3. Workaround

Recreate the new branch a second time and the files will be copied over
fields.summary: Files are not copied over when creating a new branch from the main branch

fields.description:
Currently Bitbucket provide *_Branch permissions_* feature to restrict users to merge Pull request into specific Target branch. Only users specified in *_Merge via pull request_* in _*Branch permissions*_ are allowed to merge into the target branch specified in target branch pattern.

However, currently there is no feature to restrict Pull request merge from a specific source branch. There could be use case where only specific users are allowed to merge Pull request from a specific source branch to specific target branch.
fields.summary: Pull request merge restriction based on source branch
Accessing Bitbucket Cloud using credentials through the URL throws an error message

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Some organizations would like to grant direct repo admin access to certain users, so these users can view the repo's Settings.
 However, they wouldn't like those users to be able to invite or remove users/groups from the repo.

At the moment this is not possible, as users with direct repo admin access, have access to all repo's Settings pages.
h3. Suggested Solution

1. Either disable admins with direct repo access only from accessing the *User and group access* page of the repo.

2. Since this is a feature that many users make use of and rely on, removing it may not be an option we'd want to go with. So, perhaps we could
- add a new level of permissions that would allow a user to get access to the repo's Settings, with the exception of *User and group access* page.
- give team/account administrators the option to disable invitations/user removals for (some) users with direct repo admin access.
fields.summary: Prevent users with direct repo admin access from inviting/removing users/groups to that repo

fields.description: Please consider increasing the deployment environment to have more than 10. We run a monorepo with multiple apps, and we have more than 10 apps inside the monorepo, we currently use deployment environment as variable to run the pipeline for each application.
fields.summary: Increase the maximum number of deployment environment

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When trying to create multiple blockquotes, Bitbucket is considering them all as a single blockquote.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # On a file, set Syntax mode as Markdown
 # Create two block codes such as:
{panel}
>text number1  
>text number2

>text number3  
>text number4
{panel}

h3. Expected Results
To create two blockquotes, one with text number1 and 2, another one with text number3,4
 !Screen Shot 2020-04-14 at 16.24.04.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
A single blockquote is created with text number1,2,3,4
 !Screen Shot 2020-04-14 at 16.25.09.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Creating multiple blockquotes on a markdown file group all blockquotes in a single one

fields.description:
Whenever you have a PR that has a lot of changes and you need to scroll down the page to see the rest of the changes, if you scroll down, the PR title will not scroll down with the rest of the page header.

The following example shows where the PR title could be:
 !Screen Shot 2020-04-14 at 11.26.58.png|width=506,height=296!

 

This would make navigating multiple pull requests at the same time much easier.
fields.summary: Show PR title while scrolling down

fields.description:
As a user I would like to be able to desactivate the email notifications completely.
Working only on one depot it is more effective to directly check all the active PR in the repository than to check the emails.
fields.summary: As a user being able to desactivite email notifications

fields.description:
Bitbucket Cloud should provide functionality to replace old user with another user in Org domain when a user leave the organization.

With this functionality, at the time of removing the old user leaving the organization  -
 * New user should become the owner of all artifacts, repositories, Pull requests etc owned by old user
 * And then old user should be deleted
fields.summary: Add Functionality to replace user with another user in Org domain

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Clicking on Pull request from dashboard caused the comment and sidebar to not load, refreshing the page afterward load the comment and sidebar properly. This only happens for the specific pull request that has created Jira issue created in the comment section of the specific pull request.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Link Bitbucket to JIRA with the integration
 # Create a pull request
 # Comment in the pull request
 # Create an issue on the comment
 # Open a new tab
 # Navigate to dashboard https://bitbucket.org/dashboard/overview
 # Click on the Pull request

h3. Expected Results
The sidebar and comments load up properly

h3. Actual Results
The sidebar and comments don't load up

h3. Workaround
Refresh the page.
fields.summary: Opening Pull request from dashboard that has JIRA issue created on the comment cause the comment & sidebar to not load

fields.description:
Often a comment we add to a PR needs to be able to made into a "task". Currently we have to write a comment and then duplicate the comment into a separate "task".

Example comment - this comment is effectively a task in itself:

*Can you do X?*
fields.summary: Ability to turn a comment into a task

fields.description:
Consider not loading the preview of a PR before the user selects their braches.

Sometimes the defaults that populate load HUGE amounts of changes and the page crawls.
fields.summary: Avoid Loading Preview of a PR

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Bitbucket.org website's internet connection notifications are not disappearing when you disconnect or reconnect to the internet using Ubuntu OS on Google Chrome.
 !internet_notification.png|width=474,height=150!
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Use Ubuntu OS
 # Go to Bitbucket.org or repository page
 # Disconnect from the internet
 # Re-connect to the internet

h3. Expected Results

The notifications should disappear
h3. Actual Results

Sometimes, the notifications are not disappearing
h3. Workaround

Reload the page to refresh the notification
fields.summary: Disconnecting from the internet, the notifications on BB UI are not disappearing

fields.description:
As per the title, this feature request is to add the ability for users to list all Jira issues that are linked to commits under a specified branch in Bitbucket.

This information could be provided through either the UI or the Bitbucket cloud API
fields.summary: List linked Jira issues to a specific branch

fields.description:
I am building my java+gradle project. When I configure and start pipelines, I got errors. Gradle does not exist. Should I use Gradle image or by default it exits?
{noformat}
image: openjdk:11

pipelines:
  default: #this runs for any unspecified branches
    - step:
        name: Install dependencies
        caches:
          - gradle
        script:
          - echo 'Put any bash command here'
    - step:
        name: Run tests
        script:
          - gradle test
    - step:
        name: Build artifacts
        script:
          - gradle clean build
        artifacts:
          - build/**

  pull-requests:
    '**': #this runs as default for any branch not elsewhere defined
      - step:
          name: Install dependencies
          caches:
            - gradle
          script:
            - echo 'Put any bash command here'
      - step:
          name: Run tests
          script:
            - gradle test
      - step:
          name: Build artifacts
          script:
            - gradle clean build
          artifacts:
            - build/**

  branches:
    master: #this runs only 'master' branch
      - step:
          name: Install dependencies
          caches:
            - gradle
          script:
            - echo 'Put any bash command here'
      - step:
          name: Run tests
          script:
            - gradle test
      - step:
          name: Build artifacts
          script:
            - gradle clean build
          artifacts:
            - build/**

      - step:
          name: Deploy artifacts to the server
          deployment: production
          script:
            - pipe: atlassian/scp-deploy:0.3.3
              variables:
                USER: $SERVER_USER
                SERVER: $SERVER_IP
                VERSION: $BUILD_VERSION
                REMOTE_PATH: '/var/autotrack'
                LOCAL_PATH: 'build/libs/autotrack-$VERSION.jar'
                
{noformat}
Where I was mistaken?
fields.summary: Gradle is not working in pipelines

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Currently there is no Information about Image (image ID for example) being used in Bitbucket Pipeline build. This information can be used to check if the image being used in failed and successful build has changed and investigation can be done in the right direction
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # N/A

h3. Expected Results

Pipeline build log should have the information about the Image (Image ID for example) being used in Bitbucket Pipeline
h3. Actual Results

Pipeline build log doesn't have the information about the Image (Image ID for example) being used in Bitbucket Pipeline
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Information about Image being used in Bitbucket Pipeline build

fields.description:
Problem:

Its annoying to pass all of your merge checks except the completion of the successful build, and to have to wait for the build to complete before you can come back and merge your PR.

 

Solution: 

A new option that allows you Merge a PR upon successful completion of the build. This feature would not be available as an option if you have enforced merge checks enabled, and your merge checks are not all complete aside from the successful build.
fields.summary: Merge on Completion of Build

fields.description:
Hi,

 

We are trying to setup webhook in Bitbucket repository setting. We need public IP of Bitbucket cloud to setup rule in aws for ec2 instance access. Could you please share? Accordingly we will add IP in firewall rule to allow call from bibucket to our server after developer commits on repository.

 

Thanks

Yogesh (yogesh.pa.25@gmail.com)
fields.summary: Need bitbucket public ip for firewall rule

fields.description: When viewing a branch there should be an option under the "..." menu to create a new branch from the branch currently being viewed. This is a common operation, and performing this task currently requires navigating to a separate page and manually typing in the name of the desired "from" branch, which is very cumbersome.
fields.summary: Create branch from currently viewed branch

fields.description:
It would be great to have an API that would provide results similar to git log --after="YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm" --before="YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm".

The use case would be to query many repositories for commits specific to a few dates and store these commits within a database.

Currently, a workaround for this would be to use the git log function, which requires to clone the repository locally.
fields.summary: Add a Bitbucket API to return commits on a date range

fields.description:
On the old PR experience, on the Commits tab, there was a Builds column where we could see which commit was tested and their results.

On the new experience, we can only see the Builds for the top commit.

Can you please add this Builds column to the new Commits view as well?
fields.summary: Re-add "Builds" column for commits on the new PR UI

fields.description:
Currently, Internal grants to customer's Bitbucket account and repository from Support admin makes an entry in the audit logs which looks like this:

!Screen Shot 2020-04-07 at 15.13.36.png|width=423,height=62!

It sometimes creates confusion and considered unknown access to account/repo.

It would be great to have '*{color:#00875a}Atlassian Staff access{color}*' instead of just 'staff access'.
fields.summary: Audit logs to show 'Atlassian Staff access' for internal grants

fields.description: When a PR is created and the source branch is deleted an "Open" status for a PR may be misleading as Bitbucket Cloud will not be able to render the diffs and merge the PR as the source branch is deleted. A deleted or declined state may be more suitable for this case.
fields.summary: Delete or decline the PR when the source branch is deleted

fields.description:
The menu containing the edit / share etc. items appears and disappears with scrolling.

This is a very annoying UI distraction - and users should be given the option to switch this off, effectively freezing this menu. 

If this is already available somehow then my apologies.

Paul

If this is the wrong place for Confluence suggestions, then can you please forward it on.
fields.summary: Confluence: Give option to freeze the share menu
